conclusion: Understand how position and size of objects change when light source moves backward.
Object A is on the left side of the image.
Object B is on the right side of the image.
Object C is below the objects A and B.
Object D is on the right side of the image.
Object A is positioned closer to the light source.
Object B is positioned further away from the light source.
Object C is positioned below the objects A and B.
Object D is positioned further away from the light source.
The light source's position will move downward.
The objects will shift in position relative to the light source.
Object A is on the left side of the image.
Object B is on the right side of the image.
Object C is below the objects A and B.
Object D is on the right side of the image.
The light source will move downward.
The objects will shift downward relative to the light source.
